title: Kindred requires a marksman's full build on a junglers budget
body:
And they can't even function as an efficient farmer because they have to run all over the map collecting marks.

Add on top of that they are a needy jungler who requires aid for deep marks and cannot front line.

replies.body:
Requiring a marksman build as a jungler would have been a major handicap a few seasons ago, but marksman builds are currently among the cheapest in the game, second only to support builds. I agree that Kindred doesn't feel the best, and for several of the reasons you mentioned, though I don't think it's their itemization that's the issue.

I may not be the biggest expert on Kindred, but from what I've seen their biggest problem right now is that they feel high-risk yet low-reward. Getting marks on enemy champions or in the enemy jungle can be very difficult, and is so heavily telegraphed that it's easy for an organized team to predict their movements and kill them. Getting help from teammates saps influence from the lanes, which is currently not an option at a time when leaving lane for even a short while can risk having the opposing laner deal massive damage to their tower. It's very easy to shut Kindred down, and even if they do manage to successfully get enough stacks, there are many more marksmen out there who can scale harder and more reliably.

I also think a large part of the current issue with Kindred is that they simply do not fit at all well in the current jungling meta: right now, we're back to an early-heavy, gank-heavy meta where the most successful junglers are those who can abandon farming for the entire laning phase, and gank lanes non-stop in order to get the snowball rolling. Kindred, by contrast, can't afford to do that, and in fact needs the assistance of their laners in order to not fall behind. They do gain some decent bonuses from their stacks, but that currently pales in comparison to the stat advantages laners can get if they snowball early on, particularly in bot lane. Because of this, buffing Kindred may not in fact be the most efficient solution, because once the meta eventually shifts and leaves more room for junglers who can take the time to make themselves scale, they're likely going to end up becoming far too dominant.

The issue is that crit items that are needed like IE are still expensive on a jungler since they need multiple parts to come online. I'd just say it's all down to preferences, I'm still taking sudden impact when i take domination as my secondary runeset

When you play against Kindred you should feel the same tilt as you feel when playing against Shaco, you should feel countered as you are playing jungle against gardcore counterjungler you.....you can easily counterjungle Kindred without any fear. 

Even as a hardcore jungler I still hate Shaco, when I see him I know that my jungle is gonna be in the mess unless I WORK HARD TO COUNTERPLAY AND PREDICT UNPREDICTABLE SHACO while Kindred is so damn predictable.
Define marksmen build? Because she is designed to build crit, what other jungler builds 80% crit?
I am talking about prices, not about a specific type of build. Building crit or raw damage on equall price requires the same amount farm and effort.
True they have similar requirements but they give very different power outputs. Crit is much more powerful than raw damage later.

This is true, IE itself is both a fairly expensive item and a huge part of a marksman's item-based power, a fact that often gets overlooked when comparing different build costs. In this respect, making Kindred more dependent on crit, rather than on-hit damage, as was previously the case (which also allowed them a smoother transition through Bloodrazor) definitely made their power progression much more awkward. I also agree that Kindred's jungle bounties aren't implemented in the best way, because contrary to Riot's thoughts on RNG, in practice they often end up having their mark linger on camps that either cannot be reasonably captured, or have already been taken long before they had a chance to take it.

To some larger extent, I think there is also a fundamental contradiction in Kindred in that their innate is all about making them scale, yet they were designed from the ground up to be this very early game-focused marksman, with tremendous kiting power and even sustain to let them clear and gank properly. Right now, they're in this middling state where they're not really dominant enough early to compete with hyper-gankers, but don't scale well enough into the late game either to justify picking them over a tank or most other marksmen. I think Riot may end up being forced to have to pick a direction and make them either an early game bully, in which case they should have another passive, or a carry, in which case their kiting power should likely be made to scale over game length as well.

I doubt it. Kindred is not considered a top-tier farming-type jungler (e.g Shyvana, Ivern) that would suddenly explode in popularity if the meta shifts to farming jungle instead. She just happens to be forced to stay in the jungle because it's easier to get marks that way + she needs a lot of farm in order to not fall behind. Her marks are a hinderance because it has a lot of power tied to it that it forces the rest of her kit to be sub-par. On top of that, it's extremely restrictive to acquire said marks. 

Unlike other feast-or-famine type champions, her famine is extremely god awful and you might as well stay in the fountain because once you are behind, you won't be coming back ever. When feasting, you are still barely ahead of a champion who only have 1 or 2 kills under their belt. The reason is because Kindred's kit doesn't reward your good plays; only making you somewhat playable. 

Main issue with Kindred is that she can't farm marks easily enough. Jungle marks are alright, but champion marks are disgustingly difficult to obtain. The CD to activate is way too high (makes Eve's W look quaint in comparison) and the downtime to remark is just pathetically long; might as well not gank because if you mark someone wrong, you're shit out of luck for the next couple of minutes. Even if you play well, you can't remark the same enemy champion to camp them out because hurr durr needs counterplay (meanwhile, the enemy jungler can camp a lane all day long and gain a huge benefit out of that). Kindred is the only champion in the game that dissuades camping.

If Kindred doesn't get her 4 Marks ASAP, she's useless. When she gets her 4 marks, she's still behind. Says a lot about her kit.

As a Kindred main I agree on everything you said. Exactly! If you dont get 4 marks asap you are screwed and even 4 marks aren't enough to make you relevant. Do you know what is the best way to counterplay Kindred and make sure they aint gonna get 1st mark? Let me give you one tip. When you play against her just do your 1st buff and 1 small camp than go ASAP for that 1st scuttle crab mark before Kindred finishes their 2nd buff and than go do your own 2nd buff. That happens to me every single time when I play against any slightly competitive jungler and its heartbraking. Theres no chance you can even contest it, its just gone before you reach it.

Not sure if this would help (And for that matter I don't Jungle.), but to my understanding the trouble is natural jungle paths for the enemy blocks Kindred's RNG paths which are already going to be slower/less effective to begin with...
What if Kindred's Marks were reversed? Lamb (the player) chooses what jungle camps to mark, while Wolf (RNG) Marks the champions?
This, I'd think would work out much better- Lamb marking means no more LOL RNG paths where Kindred ends up having to go from top Raptors to bottom Krugs back to right-side Wolves before heading to Left-side Gromp when Faker is sitting mid with Zoe, and Wolf means instead of being telegraphed 'hey I'm coming to gank you!' it might be more 'hey I might gank you ooor maybe your top lane is overextended and I'll go grab him because I'm closeby.'
Granted, there still can be badtimes where Wolf asks you to gank a enemy Renekton when your lanes is GP, but now the onus for dealing with marks hopefully is more on the laner since it's less likely that Kindred will have planned to go for them as opposed to being a bonus objective.

As a Kindred main who changed summoner name just because of Kindred I agree on everything people said here and with the OP as well. Kindred is really weak without marks even after the rework and getting marks is hard even tho I always manage to get up to 6+ stacks. I will list some problems with Kindred as I have a lot of experience on that champion.

1. Their early game is weak for the amount of risk they have to take in order to properly execute early game. Coubterjungling wast majority of junglers is a suicide for Kindred as they are simply stronger.

2. Getting marks on champion kills and assists is fine and satisfying, but farming marks on camps forces you to abandon an open gank on a lane. You cant blame Kindred as marks are still so important for them. You can skip 2-3 marks at max.

3. Her base stats are complete garbage and they easily fall behind after a slight misstake and theres close to no comeback. 

4. Eadily countered if enemy jungler knows how to play and it doesnt matter if you are good or bad on Kindred. When I play against Kindred I always do my 1st buff and predict their first scuttle, take it berore they reach it and than do my 2nd buff. Can you imagine Kindred seing that their 1st mark....yea 1st mark next to their 2nd buff is GONE before they killed that 2nd buff? Its devastating. 

How to fix Kindred and make them jungler that is rewarding to play? I have 3 solutions. 

1st one: Give them 20-30 seconds lead on the camp marks. I dont care if enemies can see their camps marked but Kindred should be able to see it before anyone else. Its already risky to go for that enemy kruggs or gromp, let Kindred see it 30 seconds before anyone else so they can plan it, gank or a mark. It could also encourage enemy junglers to ward their camps often which offers good counterplay. 

2nd solution: remove kindreds passive on enemy camps and neutral monsters such are Herald, Dragon and Baron, as a compensation, buff their base stats and slightly increase range on their Q. As for champion marks, leave them as they are, they are fine and its just 5 anyways, you aint gonna get all 5. 

3rd solution: Same as 2nd, remove camp marks, compensate Kindred the same way as in 2nd solution but when it comes to kill/assist marks, give them something unique, similar to Kaynes passive. If Kindred gets 4-5 marks on kills or assists on melee champions Lamb abilities (Q) get increased range and her R should in that case give bonus MS to all her allies inside of it as well as Kindred, but if Kindred gets most of their marks against ranged champions, her W and E get something special, like root, fear or something that could help them hunt ranged champions. That also perfectly fits Kindreds theme as Eternal hunters and junglers. 

Long storry short, passive is what makes Kindred hard to balance, the rest of their kit os fine as it is.
Good thing marksmen items are ridiculously underpriced
Still not for a jungler.

The main issue with Kindred and the issue that they've had since release is that there's no reason to pick them outside of just liking their theme or when they're overpowered. You'll always have a marksman in the bot lane and that marksman is the one with a support to be their bodyguard, Kindred has to do everything by themselves and thus has all the risks associated with being a marksman. 

What reason IS there to pick them? Their kit isn't that unique in terms of what it provides their team aside from their ult and in that case there are champs without the squishiness of a marksman that have similarly powerful utility moves that you could pick instead.

Compare them to Ivern, for instance, Ivern is clearly designed for the jungling role and he has unique abilities that help him do that, Kindred's unique contribution is seemingly just that they're a marksman that can jungle, which isn't enough of a reason to pick them.
